Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Immigration and Refugee Board's decision
Evidence_Assessment: Board misinterpreted timeline, underestimated FARC capabilities, incorrectly assumed group affiliation could be AUC
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Ms. Barrero's testimony considered credible but not adequately weighed
Legal_Rule: Board's decision must be supported by evidence and fall within range of acceptable outcomes
Procedural_Issue: Errors in application of evidence and legal interpretation
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board's errors undermined fairness of decision process
Key_Evidence_Considered: Testimony linking group to FARC, timeline of missing youths
Applicant_Challenge: Board erred in treatment of evidence and factual findings
Court_Result: Judicial review granted, new hearing ordered
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome: New hearing before different panel ordered
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of Board decision and re-hearing
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA (jurisdiction of Federal Court)
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 96, principles of procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution by FARC based on political opinion or membership in particular social group
Governing_Rule: Duty of decision-makers to properly analyze evidence and apply correct legal standards
